intro: Julocroton subpannosus var. formosensis, commonly known as the Formosan croton, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
